text: Johann Lahr (21 January 1913 - 24 February 1942) was a Czechoslovakian ski jumper. He competed in the individual event at the 1936 Winter Olympics. On 2 March 1941, he set personal best at 111 m (364 ft) in Planica, and not a world record as it was misconception for many years. He was killed in action during World War II. ==References== Category:1913 births Category:1942 deaths Category:People from Trutnov District Category:People from the Kingdom of Bohemia Category:German Bohemian people Category:Czech male ski jumpers Category:Czech male Nordic combined skiers Category:Olympic ski jumpers of Czechoslovakia Category:Olympic Nordic combined skiers of Czechoslovakia Category:Ski jumpers at the 1936 Winter Olympics Category:Nordic combined skiers at the 1936 Winter Olympics Category:German military personnel killed in World War II
title: Johann Lahr
